_header: Versificator is of four letters make thou a verse
_description: Three macaronic lines on ‘Ivi munivi vinum minimum munuivi’

BLRoy17Cxvii.Transcription:
Versificator es of fowre letteris mak þou a werseSemper sic
                    facito Of fyfe wordys & no moSi facio fersitam sex fete wel
                    f[…?]
BLRoy17Cxvii.Note: The ends of lines are faded and run into the spine.
BLRoy17Cxvii.Editions:
Warner,  Sir George Frederic,  and  Julius P. Gilson, eds.  
             Catalogue of Western Manuscripts in the old Royal and King’s
                Collections.
         4 vols. London: Trustees of the British Museum, 1921: 2.243.
